comments: She wowwwwwwwwwsssss her students

She is good at teaching you the ways to solve chemical questions. This is what chem102 do as well. Just read the book and do the home work, you will succeed in her class easily. Overall, she is a easy professor. I really appreciated her.
For advanced work without a doubt one of the best. There is an inability to convey basic points in chemistry much to the expense of the class.

She smiles all the time even if there\'s nothing to smile about which is so annoying. She tells you that you failed her class with a big smile. She quizzes you in all discussions while she should "discuss" the material. Her quizzes are hard as hell and her tests are even harder. Homework is due every week & she\'s a hard grader.

What can I say about Yang.. Her exams are challenging, her quizzes are harder than her exams and there is homework due every week. She does NOT teach ANY concepts but the test is 50/50 on concepts and problem solving. She made her final exams out of pure AP Chemistry (collegeboard) exam questions... I would recommend but much studying is required.

She is very enthusiastic about teaching chemistry, but sometimes sidetracks the whole class explaining. Although she speaks English there is a bit of a language barrier. The course was slow at first but picked up towards the end. All in all she was an average professor.

Elaborately explains everything. Does all work n board to explain concepts. very kind and takes time to answer all questions to make sure you understand. Custom txbk fully used and reviewed in class. fair exams just make sure to read everything in the book and review bk/in-class calculations. attd not req but it\'d b wise Def. would recommend.

She will teach you what you need to know and does everything by hand on the board. She will answer all your questions. however she is one of the most difficult and unfair graders i have ever had. if you end up having her class study a lot and check all your problems before turning them in.
Don\'t ask her questions that are answered somewhere in the book! She has a great deal of energy and she is not afraid to use it. Don\'t ask her questions that are lame! She remembers EVERYTHING!
she won\'t give you an A if you don\'t deserve one. tough grader, yet nice person.

I\'m sure Dr. Yang is well meaning and a very nice individual, she might be the worst professor I\'ve had. Her lectures, if she even gives one, are unclear and unfocused. If I didn\'t want to have a lecture, I would have taken an online class. I was excited to take biochem and this class has been very disappointing.

Biochem with her was the worst experience. Drew half of the structures wrong so lectures weren\'t reliable. Asks more questions about gen bio/gen chem and ochem than biochem , so if you don\'t remember them , you are screwed. Lies about materials that won\'t be on the test but appear on the tests. Some of her wordrings for answers are very ambiguous

Stop crying. Everything on the test is from her notes. The book is helpful to read just to clarify things. She\'s always available during office hours. The extra chapters she gave weren\'t even covered in detail, it was very general so stop whining. She only did that to give you a basic idea of the whole subject. NO MATH PROBLEMS ON EXAMS! Awesome!

Hard to understand her. She will not aswer questions and her tests were different from the lectures and textbook. She will explain balancing equations and go over it but she will only explain the basic and easy problems ahe will not explain the breakage of a compound I was able to pass her class "c" by going to tutoring and another chem 100 class

I was reluctant to take her because of what everyone said but I can safely assume now that all of the students who complained about her have to be lazy or dim. I\'m still taking the course but so far the tests have been easy and her lectures helpful. You can\'t just rely on lectures to pass a test and students are obviously doing just that.

Go to her lectures, do the study questions, and study a few days before the exam - there is no reason why you shouldn\'t get an A. If you don\'t have a good background in chemistry/biology don\'t take this class. I got an A on every exam - highly recommend her.

HORRIBLE Prof. Lectures were completely useless and had nothing to do with test questions. She refuses to answer questions in class. You must teach yourself the material and she adds 5 CH. not required . She is the worst prof ever taken. I will NEVER take a class with her again.

HORRIBLE WORST BAD prof. never take here. never ever take her. she is far from humanity. she is a lier too. she would say read notes and exam will be from there but she will give you other stuff. she is the worst I ever seen in my life. DO NOT TAKE HER if you need high GPA for medical school

Great professor. I would definitely take her again. You\'ll have to work hard for an A, but it is definitely doable. The built in curve makes anything above an 85% an A. Tries really hard to prepare you for the department final exam. She even brought it into class the week before the test and told us exactly what to study. Very reachable. Recommend.

DO NOT TAKE HER. she is the worst teacher I\'ve ever seen. I am a A student got C in her class. She is lier too. she said she will do curve but she did not. NO CURVE. she lies too much. Lecture is confusing and you will not learn anything in class. half of class dropped in first 2 weeks. Horrble teacher. DO NOT TAKE HER.
